svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - February 22 2021

title: "Week in Ethereum News
Feb 22, 2021" date: "2021-02-22"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet
• Latest core devs call . Beiko’s notes , discussion of what is needed to turn off PoW, mainnet Berlin
fork set for April 14
• List of EVM features possibly worth deleting . Let’s rip the bandaids off, turning off PoW (“the
merge”) is the opportunity
• Anyone want to become an EIP editor ?
• EthereumJS’s Typescript EVM release with critical bugfixes
• Micah Zoltu’s argument for adding BLS precompile in London fork
• London fork with EIP1559 scheduled for July , when the difficulty bomb starts to go off
• Understanding how EIP1559 helps congestion control
Proof of Stake
• eth proof of stake date to slot converter
• New Lighthouse release will help head/target attestations for whole network , so if you’re running
Lighthouse, please upgrade!
• Withdrawal credentials merged , should enable trustless staking pools
Layer2
• Celer’s cBridge , a cross-layer2 network for cheap, instant value transfers on EVM chains.
Production ready, UI coming.
• layer2.finance : pool layer2 transactions from many users into a single transaction using Celer’s
State Guardian Network for the rollup, coming in a month or two.
• Loopring’s rollup dex hasn’t been around long, has already done 500m USD , and is now doing $30m a
day
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Trail of Bits !
Trail of Bits wants YOU to apply for a position on their team! Positions are open for blockchain
security engineers, project managers, product managers, financial controllers, and more. Make a
career-defining contribution and help direct the future of blockchain security at Trail of Bits.
Stuff for developers
• Defi Simulation with Tenderly, spin up instant forks and manipulate the state/blockheight to
simulate transactions
• How to stream pending transactions with ethersjs
• Prysmatic: finding an elusive bug where database calls were inperformant on startup
• Infura: why use Infura Transactions instead of your own in-house relayer
Security/incidents
• Samsun found bug in hashmasks sale , could have re-entrancy minted thousands of hashmasks
• Primitive Finance found a bug related to infinite approvals and rescued most funds
• Immunefi advocates for a scaling bug bounty
• Malicious Hardhat npm package on hardhat-waffle instead of @nomiclabs/hardhat-waffle. Hardhat has
now squatted relevant package names. Beware of trusted code!
• Use strong Fiat-Shamir transformation and be careful when implementing snarks
• Reviews DAO : peer audits via barter
• An Eth code security checklist
Ecosystem
• Nvidia is introducing an Ethereum ASIC miner
• Why miners can be simultaneously paid too much and yet struggling to survive: miners as a group are
overpaid yet individual miners are barely breaking even
Enterprise
• Christie’s to auction a Beeple NFT , it’s first purely digital art auction. It will also accept ETH
for payment .
• Dubai government free trade zone will now accept ETH , BTC, and Tether
• Expo IDE puts some of its treasury into ETH . The devs know.
Application layer
• NyanCat creator sells NyanCat NFT for 300 ETH (~$600k) on Foundation
• Rai is live on mainnet. An Eth-collateralized asset with a reflexive self-peg set by interest rates
• Ideamarket on mainnet: bonding curves for Twitter accounts.
• uniswap over 100b lifetime volume
• PoolTogether incentivizes deposits to their no-loss lottery with the POOL governance token. Deposits
have skyrocketed ~100x
• Ribbon finance is on mainnet with a strangle option strategy - an aggregator of Hegic and Opyn
Regulation/business/tokens
• Vitalik reflects on his post-election nTrump stacking
• Rekt.news says cryptoart is art : lots of money laundering
• NFTs as “port of entry” for internet media
General
• RFP for a full verification of the Pickles SNARK on Ethereum
• Consensus for async distributed key gen
• Apple takes steps to thwart M1 Mac “Silver Sparrow” malware
• Robinhood announces it will enable deposits and withdrawals for crypto
Job Listings
• DeversiFi is hiring senior developers and marketing champions
• Are you a front-end dev? Join Balancer! Email: career [at] balancer.finance
• NEAR is looking for a React Engineer
• Trail of Bits is looking for a blockchain security engineer
• 0x: devs of all types and a data analyst
• HOPR is looking for a privacy protocol engineer .
Want your job listing here ? $345 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH (or
345 DAI or 345 USDC) to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions? thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then please put it on
an Ethereum subreddit; emails/DMs are not part of my workflow.
Please click the following if you’re interested in sponsoring the newsletter .
Twitter: follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked are. Follow @evan_van_ness to get
most of the week's news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-feb-22-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
• Feb 28 - Nimbus Grafana dashboard submissions due
• Mar 1-5 - Ethereum Foundation’s Ecosystem Support Program office hours
• Mar 5 - Financial Cryptography DeFi academic workshop
• Mar 19-21 - ETHGlobal’s NFT Hack
• Apr 9 - May 14 - ETHGlobal’s Scaling Ethereum hackathon
• April 14 - Berlin upgrade fork (testnets: Ropsten Mar 10, Goerli Mar 17, Rinkeby Mar 24)
• May 14 - papers due for WoSCA 2021
• Jul 20-22 - EthCC4 (Paris)
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
